job_title: Lab Monitor in New Britain, CT
pros: Flexible schedule that works with your school schedule. Easy to get someone to cover your shift if you're no longer available. Easy to get this position. Easy job.
cons: Minimum wage, but better than no job.

job_title: Student Worker in New Britain, CT
pros: Flexible schedule Decent wage Great managers
cons: Event support requirements can be hard to fulfill if you have a busy schedule outside of school

job_title: Teacher Assistant in New Britain, CT
pros: Flexible schedule hands on work
cons: Low pay, poor organizational skills and stock management

job_title: Tutor in New Britain, CT
pros: Flexible Schedule, decent pay for student workers
cons: Not dependable hours, high stress environment

job_title: Student Worker in New Britain, CT
pros: The right job will allow you to get work done and if you have any remaining time study because they want you to succeed as student.
cons: If you get a highly demanding job, you won't have time to study, and the job requirements can grow beyond the role which can be unfair to the student worker

job_title: Graduate Assistant in New Britain, CT
pros: Waived fees for classes + $4000 stipend
cons: As a graduate student this us great because no debt but you also break-even in terms of income.

job_title: Lab Assistant in New Britain, CT
pros: Very flexible schedules and supportive staff
cons: Cant think of any Cons it was a good experience

job_title: Computer Programmer in New Britain, CT
pros: Good pay good benefits good work life
cons: None that I can think of

job_title: Adjunct Math Professor in New Britain, CT
pros: Great collaboration with colleagues; great administration.
cons: Courses I am scheduled to teach may be taken over by a full-timer.

job_title: Rec Specialist in New Britain, CT
pros: Great Management, great coworkers, and great office environment
cons: Scheduling can be tough at times

review_title: A good academic workplace with slapdash administration
job_title: Chemist in Hartford, CT
pros: The collegiality is fantastic! At the department level, the faculty and staff work well together. People have a very student-focused mindset.
cons: The administration is very reactionary and seems to lose sight of its own long-range plan for the university.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Hartford, CT
pros: Concentration on student focus and Faculty development
cons: difficult to implement change in a timely manner

job_title: Associate Professor in New Britain, CT
pros:
Passionate professors. 
Solid support staff.
Hard working students
Large enough to have diverse degrees, small enough that you don't feel swallowed up by a machine
cons:
State teaching-focused university with budget issues
A big push to run the university like a for-profit business
Would like to see more diversity in faculty positions

job_title: Support Worker in New Britain, CT
pros: Nice working environment for staff.
cons: Lock of growth within the company.

review_title: Good job but not comparable salary
job_title: Administrative Operations Assistant in Hartford, CT
pros: Laid back environment; unionized employees have longevity.
cons: Salary is now and it’s a pretty political environment.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Terryville, CT
pros:
- Quiet
- Can get a lot of work done
- Sometimes free printing
- Learn to use a lot of software and problem solve with finicky programs/ computers/printers
cons:
- Can be hard to enforce rules and boundaries
- Can be overwhelming when classes use up the lab (conflict with other students wanting to use the lab too)

job_title: Center Manager in New Britain, CT
pros: Great environment, good workers, enjoyed the Student Center job.
cons: No negatives that I can think of.

job_title: Co-op Analyst in Hartford, CT
pros: Good schoolProfessor great Awesome clean
cons: None that I can remember

job_title: Welcome Desk Attendant in New Britain, CT
pros: Flexible scheduling and friendly environment
cons: Easy to go over hours

job_title: Associate Professor in Hartford, CT
pros: The class size is small
cons: The teaching load is high

job_title: CS Tutor in New Britain, CT
pros: the people are nice to work with. good experience
cons: currently i have no cons with the people ive worked with.

job_title: RECentral GA in New Britain, CT
pros: When I started working here I didn't think hat this would be the area I would want to be my dream job. I always wanted to be in college athletics but the recreations office had an opening and I took it. The recreations area is so much better than working in athletics. The office as an up bet and fun environment. Everyone is friendly that worker in the company and the students who use our services.
cons: There are really no cons in this position. The only con would be that there are two late nights that you work. The night shift ends at 11:30pm.

review_title: Easy but Boring Part Time Work
job_title: in Bristol, CT
pros:
-As a student, they work around your class times.
-No state or federal taxes withheld.
cons:
-Can't work more than 20 hours per week during a semester.
-Boring
-Depending on which part of campus you work, there is poor management. 
-Lazy coworkers / environment (again depending on which part of campus you work).

job_title: Graphic Designer in New Britain, CT
pros: Flexible schedule, great appreciation, good team building, holidays off and limited summer hours, get involved in campus life and knowing everyone even in other departments.
cons: The biggest downfall of student employment is either minimum wage of the lack of hours to build up the pay that you do get. Other than that, it's pretty good.

job_title: On-Site Support Service Technician in New Britain, CT
pros: I worked as a CO-OP for the organization for 6 months. My pay was $16/hr. My boss and all the management above him were easy to get a hold of and talk to. I did not receive benefits but my co-workers who were full time employees received great benefits.
cons: I saw no problems being a CO-OP. Politics within the organization seemed a bit frustrating as a full-timer.

job_title: Receptionist in New Britain, CT
pros: The staff that you work with are so friendly and loving, they genuinely feel like family! They're completely understanding and whenever you have a problem they're always there to help you out, you're problem is their problem.
cons: There was honestly no cons to working for the Student Center.  It was the best job I will ever have

job_title: Adjunct Professor in New Britain, CT
pros: Close by, constantly expanding and upgrading physical resources, lots of technology in the classroom. Many great, motivated students
cons: At the time I was there, the communication with adjuncts was minimal (at least in my department), which was a disservice to the students we served.

job_title: Student Worker in New Britain, CT
pros: Very flexible with classes, easy work load, generally very supportive and encouraging. Also had a great office. Can do homework in the office. Great letters of recommendation for employment after graduation.
cons: Low wage, only sick leave for bennefits

job_title: Associate Professor in New Britain, CT
pros: Staff and department are great.  The school itself is new and provides a nice place to work.  Course schedule is not too bad.
cons: Pay is lower than most schools.  Concerns about the growth of the school given the financial situation of the state.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in New Britain, CT
pros: Working with the future leaders of America.
cons: Adjuncts are an afterthought. Not much training and last minute cancellations make it difficult to plan.

job_title: Event Management in Plymouth, CT
pros: Flexible with school classes. Decent pay. Good people usually. Work isn’t hard. Just long hours. Usually set up break down equipment during shows.
cons: Long hours of just sitting there and monitoring equipment. Usually doing nothing. You have to deal with rude clients that don’t care about you even though you tell them you’re just trying to help.

review_title: Slow tedious job where the hours are very flexible but the job is not rewarding.
job_title: Hired Help in New Britain, CT
pros: Very flexible hours and theres no boss breathing down your neck.
cons: The job is fast paced, tedious and annoying. The paperwork consumes you,

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New Britain, CT
pros: Great school, amazing professors, great curriculum. Tuition is not very high, and you get way more than you pay for.
cons: Low amount of parking spaces. Tuition is on the rise even with the protest of students. Administration spends money in a lot of the wrong areas.

job_title: Graphic Designer
pros: Great environment and very flexible. There were a lot of benefits to this position and supervisors always made sure you had the best and most advanced equipment and software.
cons: No cons that aren't inline with typical Graphic Design hurdles.

job_title: Technician in New Britain, CT
pros: My job is ridiculously easy
cons: My boss is ridiculously hard to work with

job_title: in New Britain, CT
pros: Great job, they let you do your work, you just need to stay on top of the people that need to be buzzed in.
cons: Nothing really, I enjoyed working there

review_title: Student employees don't get nearly as much respect as they deserve.

cons: Student employees get little to no respect and make minimum wage. Students also can't get hired without work study.

job_title: Student Worker in New Britain, CT
pros: Location, working with other students, getting great job experience before graduation

job_title: Research Assistant in New Britain, CT
